[[File:Robin Wood - Mathom lore.jpg: '''Mathoms''' was an old word of the [[Hobbitish
thumb: hobbit-dialect]], not recorded as being in use outside [[the Shire]]. It was used to refer to "trinkets" or any item that had no particular immediate use.

[[File:Robin Wood - Mathom lore.jpg: Mathoms were many of the presents that passed from hand to hand by the [[Shire-hobbits]] - an important part of their culture - and whose owners did not wish to throw them away.
Eventually they were stored in the [[Mathom-house]] in [[Michel Delving]].<ref>{{FR
''Mathom'' is a word invented by [[J.R.R. Tolkien
thumb: Tolkien]], constructed from an obsolete [[Old English]] word ''máðm'' "treasure, precious thing".<ref>{{HM

[[File:Robin Wood - Mathom lore.jpg: It is used as a rendering of the original [[Hobbitish]] word ''[[kast]]''.<ref name="AppF">{{App
